alert.note: Alert for Lowndes; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 03 at 9:19PM CST until February 04 at 4:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Lowndes and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 315 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 919 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Montgomery, Prattville, Fort Deposit, Hayneville, Pike Road, Coosada, Pintlala, Hope Hull, Dannelly Field, Hyundai Motors Of Alabama, Woodcrest, Snowdoun, Davenport, Maxwell Air Force Base, Pinedale, Alabama State University, Hunter, Montgomery Riverwalk Stadium, Alabama State Capitol and Montgomery Zoo.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
